title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class from a subpackage using the ajc command, a new directory "subpackage" is created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: But it will be nice to have the same behavior as javac.
SR: To reproduce the issue, use the ajc command with the -d option while correctly compiling classes from a subpackage.
